doc:
Emma Nevada https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emma_Nevada 0 Emma Nevada (née Wixom) (7 February 1859 – 20 June 1940) was an American operatic soprano particularly known for her performances in operas by Bellini and Donizetti and the French composers Ambroise Thomas, Charles Gounod, and Léo Delibes. Considered one of the finest coloratura sopranos of the late 19th and early 20th centuries, her most famous roles were Amina in La sonnambula, and the title roles in Lakmé, Mignon, Mireille, and Lucia di Lammermoor. Emma_Nevada ( née_Wixom ) ( 7_February_1859 – 20_June_1940 ) was an_American_operatic_soprano particularly_known for her_performances in operas by Bellini_and_Donizetti and the_French_composers_Ambroise_Thomas , Charles_Gounod , and Léo_Delibes . Considered one of the_finest_coloratura_sopranos of the_late_19th_and_early_20th_centuries , her_most_famous_roles were Amina in La_sonnambula , and the_title_roles in Lakmé , Mignon , Mireille , and Lucia_di_Lammermoor .
